{{quote|When the black breath blows
and death's shadow grows
and all lights pass,
come athelas! come athelas!
Life to the dying
In the king's hand lying!''|The herb-master in the [[Houses of Healing]], quoting "doggerel" spoken by [[Ioreth]]{{RK|Houses}}, p. 865}} [[File:Chris Cold - The Black Breath.jpg|thumb|250px|right|"The Black Breath" by [[:Category:Images by Chris Cold|Chris Cold]]]] The '''Black Breath''' or '''Black [[Shadow]]''' was a weapon used by the [[Nazgûl]]. The Ringwraiths' breath was poisonous and could overpower those affected by it. This evil blight caused their victims to slip into a dark cold sleep and never recover. Those stricken by the malady murmured in their sleep until a grey shadow fell on their faces as they fell into the darkness. ==History== After the [[Witch-king]] led [[Sauron's attack on Osgiliath]], news of a "Black Shadow" reached [[Eriador]] and [[Gandalf]] felt a sense of dread.{{FR|Council}} In the evening of [[29 September]] {{TA|3018}},{{App|Great}}, entry for the year 3018 September 29 [[Meriadoc Brandybuck]] left [[the Prancing Pony]] and went for a stroll in [[Bree]]. He saw and followed (or was drawn by) a dark shadow, but then fell unconscious. [[Aragorn|Strider]] stated that Merry had been overcome by the Black Breath.{{FR|Strider}}, pp. 172-3 During the [[Siege of Gondor]] many were wounded and those stricken by the Black Shadow were brought to the [[Houses of Healing]], but the healers could not find a remedy. In the last retreat before the city of [[Minas Tirith]] was besieged, [[Faramir]] fell under the shadow while fighting to hold his outpost, and after being struck with an arrow was brought to the Houses of Healing on [[13 March]] {{TA|3019|n}}.{{App|Great}}, entry for the year 3019 March 13{{RK|Siege}}, p. 810 It appears that both Merry and [[Éowyn]] were exposed to the Black Breath when they fought the [[Witch-king]] during the [[Battle of the Pelennor Fields]]{{RK|Battle}}, p. 841 on [[15 March]] {{TA|3019|n}}.{{App|Great}}, entry for the year 3019 March 15 Later on that day after the battle Aragorn came to the [[Houses of Healing]] and recognized that Faramir was suffering from the Black Breath. Aragorn used ''[[athelas]]'' to cure Faramir, Éowyn, Merry and others who had been hurt by the Black Breath. This led to the rapidly spread news that the King had returned.{{RK|Houses}}, p. 860-871 {{references}} [[Category:Magic]] [[Category:Nazgûl]] [[de:Schwarzer Anhauch]] [[fi:Musta Hengitys]]
